doc.after: The use of 0 as a number should be distinguished from its use as a placeholder numeral in place-value systems. Many ancient texts usedÂ 0. Babylonian (Modern Iraq) and Egyptian texts used it. Egyptians used the word nfr to denote zeroÂ balance in double entry accounting entries. Indian texts used a Sanskrit word Shunye or shunya to refer to the concept of void. In mathematics texts this word often refers to the number zero.[12]
